CatDescriptText: Mrs. Charles Smith, waitress, 527 Delmont Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe churches of any denomination receive appreciation financial help from racketeers?" answer reads: "There are contributions, but those from the racketeers make up just a small percentage of the contributions.  I don't think that it keeps ministers from criticizing anything which needs to be criticized."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Charles Smith wearing light colored hat with dark stripe and bow in back, and furry coat, holding dark handbag on left arm, standing in front of light colored building with store windows on either side, including one with pastry display and signs that read "Blackeye Peas 19c 35c" and "Soup 3 for 29c"on left
